info.title: Splunk Enterprise Security API Reference
info.description: The Splunk Enterprise Security API allows you to use and modify findings, investigations, risk scores, assets, and identities in Splunk Enterprise Security.

stack.description: This value is assigned by the service provider. For example, `blueridge.splunkcloud.com`.

port.description: This value is assigned by the service provider. For example `8089`.

tags.name: Responseplan
tags.description: Splunk Enterprise Security Response Plan Endpoints.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the asset.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

get.description: Retrieve assets using the ID of the KV collection assets_by_str. Requires mc_assets_read or admin_all_objects capabilities.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A list of `id` (GUID) or `display_id` from an investigation separated by commas.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of investigations that are returned on the page. Return value of None displays 20 investigations on the page. A maximum limit of 100 investigations can be displayed on the page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Parameter used together with the limit parameter to specify the starting point of the returned results. If offset is not set, the default value is 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Parameter used to sort investigations. The default value is `create_time:desc` that sorts the investigations in decreasing order of the creation time. When sorting on multiple fields, each item can be separated by ",".

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: The disposition ID or disposition label of an investigation.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status ID or status label of an investigation.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The owner of an investigation.

parameters.name: urgency
parameters.description: The urgency of an investigation. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

parameters.name: sensitivity
parameters.description: The sensitivity of an investigation. Valid choices are `White`, `Green`, `Amber`, `Red`, or `Unassigned`.

parameters.name: create_time_min
parameters.description: The minimum time during which investigations were created.

parameters.name: create_time_max
parameters.description: The maximum time during which investigations were created.

parameters.name: update_time_min
parameters.description: The minimum time during which investigations were updated.

parameters.name: update_time_max
parameters.description: The maximum time during which investigations were updated.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

get.description: Retrieve investigations using query parameters. Requires mc_investigation_read or admin_all_objects capabilities.

post.description: Create investigations using provided fields. Requires mc_investigation_write and edit_notable_events OR admin_all_objects capabilities.

requestBody.description: Request payload to create an investigation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID or display id of an investigation.

post.description: Update the investigation by id. Requires mc_investigation_write and edit_notable_events OR admin_all_objects capabilities.
post.summary: Update certain fields of an investigation by id

requestBody.description: Request payload to update an investigation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The `id` (GUID) or the `display_id` of the finding or investigation that the event is associated with.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keywords to be searched for in the title or content of notes.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The source type of a note. Only notes of this type will be returned. Available options are Task, Incident, or All.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of notes that are returned on the page. The maximum number of notes that can be returned is 100. If the limit is not set, the default is 5.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Parameter used with the limit parameter to determine the range of the results. If the offset is not set, the default is 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Parameter used to sort the results. Available options are create_time:1, update_time:1, create_time:-1 and update_time:-1.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

get.description: The API endpoint for getting notes from a finding or investigation.

200.description: Get notes from the finding or investigation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The `id` (GUID) or the `display_id` of the finding or investigation that the event is associated with.

parameters.name: notable_time
parameters.description: Optional field denoting the `_time` that the finding was created. Value can be in relative, ISO, or epoch time.

parameters.description: The number of notes that are returned on the page. The maximum number of notes that can be returned is 100. If the limit is not set, the default is 5.

parameters.name: sort

parameters.name: id

post.description: The API endpoint for adding findings to an investigation.

requestBody.description: The request body for adding findings to an investigation.

parameters.name: finding_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of findings (event_id's) separated by a comma.

parameters.name: urgency
parameters.description: The urgency of a finding. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of a finding. Go to the Splunk Enterprise Security app and select **Configure**. Select **Findings and Investigations** and then select **Status** to identify the status of findings.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The owner of a finding.

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: The disposition of a finding. Go to the Splunk Enterprise Security app and select **Configure**. Select **Findings and Investigations** and then select **Disposition** to identify the disposition of the findings.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of findings that are returned on the page. The maximum number of findings that can be returned is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Parameter used with the limit parameter to determine the range of the results. If the offset is not set, the default is 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Parameter based on which the findings are sorted.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The API will return only the fields explicitly provided by the user, excluding any unspecified fields from the response.

parameters.name: earliest
parameters.description: The earliest time defined for the findings. All findings returned have a _time greater or equal to this value. This value can be in relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: The latest time defined for the findings. All findings returned have a _time less than or equal to this value. This value can be in relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time. If no value is provided, the default value is to the current time - now.

parameters.name: rule_title
parameters.description: The description of the rule that the search looks for and the security use case that it addresses.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

get.description: The API for retrieving findings by the querying fields. Requires mc_investigation_read or admin_all_objects capabilities.
get.summary: Retrieve findings by the querying fields

example.disposition_description: This disposition shows that there is a possibility for a false positive.
example.rule_title: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net
example.rule_description: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period
example.search_name: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule
example.status_description: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

items.disposition_description: This disposition shows that there is a possibility for a false positive.
items.rule_title: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net
items.rule_description: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period
items.search_name: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule
items.status_description: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

post.description: Create a manual finding in Splunk Enterprise Security.

get.description: Retrieve a finding using its ID. Requires mc_investigation_read or admin_all_objects capabilities.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the finding.

parameters.name: earliest
parameters.description: The earliest time specified for the findings. All the findings returned must have a _time greater or equal to this value. This value can be relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time. If no value is provided, the default value is the previous 24 hours.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: The latest time specified for the findings. All the findings returned must have a _time less than or equal to this value. This value can be relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time. If no value is provided, the default value is "now".

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Returns the fields that are provided by the user, excluding any unspecified fields from the response.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

example.disposition_description: This disposition shows that there is a possibility for a false positive.
example.rule_title: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net
example.rule_description: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period
example.search_name: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule
example.status_description: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the identity.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

get.description: Retrieve an identity using the ID of the identity. Requires mc_identity_read or admin_all_objects capabilities.

x-splunk-soar-connector-gen.actionName: create risk modifier of a risk entity

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The risk entity to which the risk modifier is added.

requestBody.description: The request body for updating the risk score of a risk entity.

201.description: Updated the risk score of a risk entity.

x-splunk-soar-connector-gen.displayName: get risk scores for a risk entity
x-splunk-soar-connector-gen.actionName: get risk scores for a risk entity

get.description: Get the risk scores for a risk entity in Splunk Enterprise Security. Requires mc_risk_score_write or admin_all_objects capabilities.
get.summary: Get risk scores for a risk entity

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The entity to get risk scores for.

parameters.name: entity_type
parameters.description: A comma separated list of entity types to query for a specific entity.

parameters.name: earliest
parameters.description: The earliest time specified for the search against the Risk data model to get the risk scores for the entity value. This value can be relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time. If the earliest or latest times are not provided, risk scores will be read against the cached risk scores from the lookup cache tables that are generated by the saved searches `Risk Correlation By User - Lookup Gen`, `Risk Correlation By System - Lookup Gen` and `Risk Correlation By Other - Lookup Gen` if they are enabled.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: The latest time specified for the search against the Risk data model to get the risk scores for the entity value. This value can be relative time (-30m), epoch time, or ISO 8061 time. If the earliest or latest times are not provided, risk scores will be read against the cached risk scores from the lookup cache tables that are generated by the saved searches `Risk Correlation By User - Lookup Gen`, `Risk Correlation By System - Lookup Gen` and `Risk Correlation By Other - Lookup Gen` if they are enabled.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of risk scores to be returned on the page. The default limit is 20. The limit can be a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used with limit to determine result range to pull from results. If the offset is not set, the default is 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field that the list of risk scores will be sorted on. The default value is `risk_score:desc` (Sort by risk score in decreasing order). Sorting can only be applied to the fields risk_score and entity_type. One sort field can only be provided.

parameters.name: search_format
parameters.description: If true, the response will be formatted so that it can be used in a splunk search with the `rest` command.

200.description: Retrieved risk scores for a risk entity

last_job_id.description: The last job ID of the Splunk SOAR action.

action.description: The action ID of the Splunk SOAR action.

app_id.description: The app ID of the Splunk SOAR action.

asset.description: The asset of the Splunk SOAR action.

parameters.description: The parameters for the Splunk SOAR action. For example, {"ip":"1.1.1.1"}.

update_time.description: The time the Splunk SOAR action was updated.

create_time.description: The time the Splunk SOAR action was created.

FileObject.description: Information on files stored in Splunk Enterprise Security.

id.description: The unique ID for this file.

_key.description: The KVStore key for this file, same as ID.

incident_type.description: The investigation type of the investigation. Investigation types are used to categorize related investigations by use case or source.

incident_id.description: The investigation ID of the object that attached this file.

id.description: The response plan ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response plan.

id.description: The response phase ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response phase.

id.description: The response task ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response task.

reference_list.description: A list of object IDs (response note, task, etc.) that uploaded this file.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

source_type.description: The type of object that added this file. Available options are Task, Incident, or Note.

source.description: The ID of the object (response note, task, etc.) that added this file.

source_user.description: The username of the user that added this file.

created_on.description: The time when this file was initially added.

file_key.description: The sha256 hash of the contents of this file.

_user.description: User field generated by Splunk and added to the KV Store.

CreateNotePayload.description: The Splunk Enterprise Security create note request payload.

title.description: The title of the response plan note.

content.description: The data stored within the note.

files.description: An array of file IDs to add to a note.

UpdateNotePayload.description: The Splunk Enterprise Security update note request payload.

title.description: The title of the response plan note.

content.description: The data stored within the note.

files.description: An array of file IDs to add to a note.

id.description: The ID of the created note.

record_type.description: Type of the record. Could be Finding, Finding Group, or Investigation.

record_title.description: The name of the finding or investigation or finding group.

is_imported.description: Whether the notes is from the included findings/finding group or from the original investigation.

record_time.description: Field denoting the `_time` that the finding/finding group was created. Value in epoch time.

author.description: The user who created the note.

username.description: The username of Splunk user who added the note.

last_edited_by.description: The email address of the user who edited the note most recently.

id.description: The response plan ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response plan.

id.description: The response phase ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response phase.

id.description: The response task ID if this was a file uploaded from a response task.

name.description: The name of the response task.

source.description: The ID of the object that added this note.

source_type.description: The type of object that added this note. Available options are Task or Incident.

incident_id.description: The ID of the finding or investigation that contains this note.

files.description: The list of files added to the note.

items.description: The file IDs of the files added to the note.

create_time.description: The time when the note was created.

update_time.description: The time when the note was updated.

id.description: The ID of the response task.

tag.description: The ID of the task that maps a response plan task to its original template.

status.description: The status of the task. Available options are Pending, Started, Ended, or Reopened.

order.description: The order of the task in respect to all tasks in the phase.

description.example: Create any necessary tickets or tracking documents describing the initial conditions of the suspicious email investigation. As additional information is collected or actions are taken in the following tasks and phases, update the ticket with links and relevant information to allow collaboration and tracking.

is_note_required.description: Determines whether a note is required to be created in order to complete or end the task.

start_time.description: The time at when the task was started.

end_time.description: The time at when the task was ended.

create_time.description: The time when the task was created.

update_time.description: The time when the task was last updated.

total_time_taken.description: The time taken to complete a task in seconds.

ResponsePlan.description: A response plan that can be added to an investigation.

id.description: The unique ID for the response plan.

version.description: The version of the response plan.

is_default.description: Whether or not the response plan is the default plan.

source_template_id.description: The ID of the source template for this response plan.

create_time.description: The time the response plan was created.

update_time.description: The time the response plan was last updated.

name.description: The name of the response plan.

description.description: The description of the response plan.
description.example: There are many ways in which attackers can use email to gain a foothold in an organization or advance an existing campaign. This response template guides an analyst through the process of investigating and remediating several of these methods.

template_status.description: The status of the response plan. For example, “In Progress”.

creator.description: The person who created this plan.

updated_by.description: The person who updated the plan.

example.name: Suspicious Email
example.description: There are many ways in which attackers can use email to gain a foothold in an organization or advance an existing campaign. This response template guides an analyst through the process of investigating and remediating several of these methods.
example.creator: Splunk

tasks.description: Create any necessary tickets or tracking documents describing the initial conditions of the suspicious email investigation. As additional information is collected or actions are taken in the following tasks and phases, update the ticket with links and relevant information to allow collaboration and tracking.

InvestigationGetResponse.description: The response of the get investigation api call.

mc_create_time.description: The time when the finding or investigation was created or imported into Splunk Enterprise Security.

create_time.description: The time when the investigation was created.

update_time.description: The time when the investigation was last updated.

investigation_guid.description: The ID (GUID) of the investigation that was retrieved.

investigation_id.description: The short ID of the investigation for display.

source.description: The detection that generated the investigation.

incident_origin.description: Identifies where the investigation came from. For example, whether the investigation came from Splunk Enterprise Security, a risk-based alerting finding, or a Splunk Enterprise Security finding.

investigation_type.description: The type of the investigation. Investigation types are used to categorize related investigations by use case or source.

finding_id.description: The ID of the originating Splunk Enterprise Security finding.

disposition.description: The disposition ID of the investigation.

status.description: The status ID of the investigation.

owner.description: The person assigned to the investigation.

urgency.description: The urgency of the investigation. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the investigation. Valid choices are `White`, `Green`, `Amber`, `Red`, or `Unassigned`.

excluded_finding_ids.description: List of findings or intermediate findings in the finding groups that are removed from the investigation.

finding.description: The raw data in a finding.

attachments.description: Array of file IDs that are added directly to the investigation.

notes.description: Array of note IDs that are added directly to the finding or investigation.

current_response_plan_phase.description: The data surrounding the current phase of the response plan.

response_plans.description: The array of response plans added to the investigation.

investigations.description: The investigation IDs to which the investigation is added.

findings.description: The findings IDs that are added to the investigation.

field_inheritors.description: The added finding IDs that will inherit this investigation's owner, status, urgency, sensitivity, and disposition values.

consolidated_findings.description: The consolidated list of fields for the findings and all the findings that are added to this investigation. These appear on the **Overview** tab.

count_findings.description: The number of findings or intermediate findings that are associated with this investigation or finding-based-detection (FBD) group.

risk_event_count.description: The number of risk events that are associated with this investigation.

src.description: The list of values for the `source` field.

dest.description: The list of values for the `destination` field.

dvc.description: The list of values for the `device` field.

orig_host.description: List of values for the `host` field.

src_user.description: The list of values for the `source user` field.

user.description: The list of values for the `user` field.

risk_score.description: The number that represents the maximum risk score for all the findings added to the investigation.

risk_object.description: The list of entities for a finding, a finding group, or an investigation.

risk_object_type.description: The list of risk object types for a finding, a finding group, or an investigation.

status_name.description: The status name of the investigation.

disposition_name.description: The disposition name of the investigation.

InvestigationUpdatePayload.description: Request payload to update an investigation.

name.description: The new name of the investigation to be created.

description.description: The new description of the investigation to be created.

status.description: The new status id or status label of the investigation to be created.

owner.description: The new owner of the investigation to be created.

urgency.description: The new urgency of the investigation to be created. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

sensitivity.description: The new sensitivity of the investigation to be created. Valid choices are `White`, `Green`, `Amber`, `Red`, or `Unassigned`.

investigation_type.description: The new investigation type of the investigation to be created.

InvestigationCreatePayload.description: Request payload to create an investigation.

name.description: The name of the investigation to be created.

description.description: The description of the investigation to be created.

investigation_type.description: The type of the investigation to be created.

status.description: The status ID or status label of the investigation to be created.

disposition.description: The disposition ID or disposition label of the investigation to be created.

owner.description: The owner of the investigation to be created.

urgency.description: The urgency of the investigation to be created. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the investigation to be created. Valid choices are `White`, `Green`, `Amber`, `Red`, or `Unassigned`.

finding_ids.description: The list of IDs (event_ids) for findings added to the investigation.

finding_times.description: The list of times for findings added to the investigation. Value can be in relative, ISO, or epoch time.

InvestigationCreateResponse.description: The response of the create investigation api call.

investigation_guid.description: The ID (GUID) of the investigation that was created.

InvestigationUpdateResponse.description: The response of the update investigation api call.

investigation_guid.description: The ID (GUID) of the investigation that was created.

AddFindingsToInvestigationPayload.description: Request payload to add findings to an investigation.

finding_ids.description: The list of IDs (event_ids) for findings added to the investigation.

finding_times.description: The list of times for findings added to the investigation. Value can be in relative, ISO, or epoch time.

AddFindingsToInvestigationResponse.description: The response of the add findings to investigation api call.

investigation_guid.description: The ID (GUID) of the investigation findings were added to.

AssetsGetResponse.description: The response of the get assets api call.

_last_updated.description: The last time the asset was updated.

asset.description: The IP address, DNS name, MAC address, and the Windows NT host field of the asset.

dns.description: The name of the domain name server of the asset.

ip.description: The IP address of the asset.

mac.description: The MAC address of the asset.

nt_host.description: The Windows NT host of the asset.

pci_domain.description: The domain for the asset that is related to PCI.

bunit.description: The business unit of the asset. Parameter used to filter by dashboards in Splunk Enterprise Security.

category.description: A pipe-delimited list of logical classifications for assets.

city.description: The city in which the asset is located.

country.description: The country in which the asset is located.

is_expected.description: Parameter that indicates whether events from this asset are expected. If set to true, the Expected Host Not Reporting detection performs an adaptive response action when this asset stops reporting events.

lat.description: The latitude of the asset in decimal degrees, using +/- to indicate direction.

long.description: The longitude of the asset in decimal degrees, using +/- to indicate direction.

owner.description: The user or department associated with the device.

priority.description: The priority assigned to the device ti calculate the **Urgency** field for findings on the analyst queue. An "unknown" priority reduces the assigned **Urgency** by default.

requires_av.description: Parameter that indicates whether this asset must have anti-virus software installed.

should_timesync.description: Parameter that indicates whether this asset must be monitored for time-sync events. If set to true, the Should Timesync Host Not Syncing detection performs an adaptive response action if this asset does not report any time-sync events from the past 24 hours.

should_update.description: Parameter indicates whether this asset must be monitored for system update events.

_delete.description: Parameter indicates whether this asset was deleted.

cim_entity_zone.description: Required parameter when entity zones are turned on. Lowercase word to use as a default zone name. Used when you have multiple private IP spaces. This parameter auto-populates in the cim_entity_zone fields if you do not specify your own values when formatting an asset or identity list as a lookup.

FindingsGetResponse.description: The response of the get findings api call.

host.description: The host name of the stack from which this finding was created.

source.description: The detection that created this finding.

sourcetype.description: The source type of the finding.

detection_id.description: The ID of the detection used to populate the finding.

disposition_default.description: The flag to determine whether the disposition is the default disposition.

disposition_description.description: The description for the disposition value.
disposition_description.example: This disposition shows that there is a possibility for a false positive.

disposition_label.description: The descriptive value for the disposition that is displayed on the Splunk Enterprise Security UI.

event_id.description: The unique ID for this finding.

rule_title.description: The rule title for this event.
rule_title.example: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net

rule_description.description: The description for the rule that was used to find and create the finding.
rule_description.example: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period

security_domain.description: The security domain for the finding.

risk_object.description: The risk object for which this finding was created.

risk_object_type.description: The type of risk object from which this finding was created.

risk_score.description: The risk score assigned to this risk object.

search_name.description: The search that was used to create this finding.
search_name.example: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule

severities.description: A list of severity values for the finding.

severity.description: The level of severity for the finding.

status_default.description: The flag to determine whether this status is the default status set in the system configurations.

status_description.description: The description for the status value.
status_description.example: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

status_label.description: The descriptive label for the status value that is displayed on the Splunk Enterprise Security UI.

urgency.description: The urgency value for the finding. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

_time.description: The time when this finding was created.

example.disposition_description: This disposition shows that there is a possibility for a false positive.
example.rule_title: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net
example.rule_description: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period
example.search_name: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule
example.status_description: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

CreateManualFindingRequest.description: The request of the create manual finding api call.

rule_title.description: The rule title for the manual finding.
rule_title.example: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net

rule_description.description: The rule description for the manual finding.
rule_description.example: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period

security_domain.description: The security domain for the manual finding to be created.

risk_object.description: The risk object for the manual finding to be created.

risk_object_type.description: The risk object type for the manual finding to be created.

risk_score.description: The risk score for the manual finding to be created.

status.description: The status id or status label of the manual finding to be created.

urgency.description: The urgency id or urgency label of the manual finding to be created.

owner.description: The owner for the manual finding to be created.

disposition.description: The disposition id or disposition label of the manual finding to be created.

drilldown_searches.description: The drilldown searches for the manual finding to be created.

annotations.description: The annotations for the manual finding to be created.

risk_event_count.description: The risk event count for the manual finding to be created.

all_risk_objects.description: The risk objects for the manual finding to be created.

source.description: The sources for the manual finding to be created.

exclude_map_fields.description: The fields to exclude from the automatic 'orig_' prefix mapping. When writing data to the notable index, the backend will append 'orig_' prefix to certain fields. For fields specified in the `exclude_map_fields`, the backend will not append this prefix. To see which fields will automatically get the prefix, check the `mapfields` parameter in the definition of the notable alert action.

example.rule_title: 24 hour risk threshold exceeded for user=evilsender@update.defenceonline.net
example.rule_description: Risk Threshold Exceeded for an object over a 24 hour period

CreateManualFindingResponse.description: The response of the create manual finding api call.

_time.description: The time when this finding was created.

finding_id.description: The source_event_id of the finding event written to the index.

risk_object.description: The risk object for which this finding was created.

risk_object_type.description: The type of risk object from which this finding was created.

risk_score.description: The risk score assigned to this risk object.

urgency.description: The urgency value for the finding. Valid choices are `informational`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`, or `unknown`.

info_max_time.description: The maximum time of the finding.

drilldown_searches.description: The drilldown searches for the finding.

example.search_name: Risk - 24 Hour Risk Threshold Exceeded - Rule
example.status_description: Finding is recent and not reviewed.

DrilldownSearch.description: The drilldown search for the manual finding to be created.

IdentityGetResponse.description: The response of the get identity by id api call.

_last_updated.description: The last time the identity was updated.

bunit.description: The business unit of the asset.

email.description: The email address of an identity.

first.description: The first name of an identity.

identity.description: A pipe-delimited list of username strings representing the identity.

last.description: The last name of an identity.

phone.description: A pipe delimited field for the telephone number of an identity.

startDate.description: The start or hire date of an identity.

work_city.description: The primary work site city for an identity.

work_country.description: The primary work site country for an identity.

work_lat.description: The latitude of the primary work site city in decimal degrees, using +/- to indicate direction.

work_long.description: The longitude of the primary work site city in decimal degrees using +/- to indicate direction.

RiskScoreUpdatePayload.description: The request body for updating the risk score of a risk entity.

risk_modifier.description: The risk score delta to be added to the risk entity.

entity_type.description: The type of the risk entity.

RiskScoreUpdateResponse.description: The response body for updating the risk score of a risk entity.

message.example: The risk score of the 2.2.2.2 with type being user has been updated to 90.

example.message: The risk score of the 2.2.2.2 with type being user has been updated to 90.

RiskScoreRetrieveResponse.description: The response body for retrieving the risk scores for a risk entity.

entity.description: The entity value of the risk score.

risk_score.description: The risk score for the entity value.

entity_type.description: The entity type of the entity with this risk score.

RateLimitExceededResponse.description: Splunk Enterprise Security Rate Limit Exception Response.

code.description: The custom error code for the rate limit errors.

request_id.description: The request ID of the API call.

message.example: User has exceeded the rate limits for this API: get_identity_by_id with limit 100

example.message: User has exceeded the rate limits for this API: get_identity_by_id with limit 100

request_id.description: The request ID of the API call.
